hints.content:
The area is the amount of flat space a shape takes up. 

We can find the area by counting the number of unit squares that the shape covers.

$\blueD{\text{Shape A}}$ has an area of $\blueD9$ square units.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 5 rows and 2 columns of 9 unit squares connected together on a grid. First, second, third, and fifth rows from the top each have 2 unit squares and the fourth row from the top has 1 unit square. The unit squares that make up shape A are labeled 1 through 9. Shape B with 4 rows and 4 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. Top row has 2 unit squares, second row from the top has 4 unit squares, and third and fourth rows from the top each have 1 unit square. !

hints.content:
$\maroonD{\text{Shape B}}$ has an area of $\maroonD{8}$ square units.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 5 rows and 2 columns of 9 unit squares connected together on a grid. First, second, third, and fifth rows from the top each have 2 unit squares and the fourth row from the top has 1 unit square. Shape B with 4 rows and 4 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. Top row has 2 unit squares, second row from the top has 4 unit squares, and third and fourth rows from the top each have 1 unit square. The unit squares that make up shape B are labeled 1 through 8. !

hints.content:
Shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers *more* unit squares on the grid than shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is *greater* than the area of shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

question.content:
Each square in the grid is a unit square with an area of $1$ square unit.  

**Fill in the blanks.**

Shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers [[☃ dropdown 1]] unit squares on the grid than shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of shape $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is  [[☃ dropdown 2]]  than the area of shape $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 5 rows and 2 columns of 9 unit squares connected together on a grid. First, second, third, and fifth rows from the top each have 2 unit squares and the fourth row from the top has 1 unit square. Shape B with 4 rows and 4 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. Top row has 2 unit squares, second row from the top has 4 unit squares, and third and fourth rows from the top each have 1 unit square. !
